title: I.Sicily inscription 003376
support: Upper left corner of a large slab, broken on right and below, with a recessed moulding on the left edge. Orsi speculates could have been part of a cippus covering a tomb.

layout.p: Remains of a single line of large Greek letters

provenanceFound._: From tomb 15 of the archaic necropolis in contrada Cuciniello/Cucinello, excavated by Orsi in 1898, vicinity of Ragusa station

graphics.desc: Photo Museo Arch. Reg. P.Orsi Siracusa, neg.11373-B (Sep.1960), Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
